鼸字的基本解释

鼸
xiàn
田鼠。

鼸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiàn］
［《廣韻》胡忝切，上忝，匣。］
田鼠的一种。亦名香鼠，灰色短尾，能颊中藏食。

鼸字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【鼠字部】　鼸； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1529第23
【唐韻】【集韻】?丘檢切，欠上聲。【說文】䶃也。　又【廣韻】胡忝切【集韻】【韻會】下忝切，?音㺌。【玉篇】田鼠也。【爾雅·釋獸】鼸鼠。【註】以頰裹藏食。　又【釋名】頷，或曰鼸車，鼸鼠之食積於頰，人食似之，故取名也。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋獸】鼸鼠。【註】以頰裏藏食。〕　謹照原文頰裏改頰裹。
鼸字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
鼸字的起名意思

暂无。

Emu
Basic explanation of words
Emu
xiàn
Vole.
Emu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xiàn］
["Guangyun" Hu Nian cut, upper nun, box. ]
A kind of voles. Also known as the sweet rat, it has a short gray tail and can hide food in its cheeks.
Emu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Mouse Character Department] 　鼸; Kangxi Strokes: 23; Page Number: Page 1529 Page 23
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Qiu inspected and cut, owing to the voice. [Said the text] Chen Ye.　 [Guang Yun] Hu Nian cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] next cut,? Yin 㺌. [Jade articles] Voles too. 【Erya·Shi Beast】Musk. [Note] Wrap your cheeks to hide food.　 [Release the name] 颔, or 鼸車, the food of the mouse accumulates on the cheeks, and humans eat it like it, so the name is also named. Textual research: [[Erya·Shiju] Mochi. [Note] Hide food in cheeks. 〕 　 I would like to change the cheek wrap according to the original text.
Emu
